intro: Cynoglossum corymbiforme, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Cynoglossum corymbiforme is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
